title: Adobe ColdFusion Access Control Bypass - CVE-2023-38205
content:
Description:
Hi team,
The subdomain https://████ is with adobe ColdFusion vulnerable with CVE-2023-38205.
This vulnerability is a bypass path created for CVE-2023-29298.
References
https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/07/19/cve-2023-38205-adobe-coldfusion-access-control-bypass-fixed/
Impact
If an attacker accesses a URL path of /hax/..CFIDE/wizards/common/utils.cfc the access control can be bypassed and the expected endpoint can still be reached, even though it is not a valid URL path .
System Host(s)
█████████
Affected Product(s) and Version(s)
CVE Numbers
CVE-2023-38205
Steps to Reproduce
Go to: https://█████████/hax/..CFIDE/wizards/common/utils.cfc?method=wizardHash&inPassword=foo&_cfclient=true&returnFormat=wddx
See the remote method call wizardHash on the/CFIDE/wizards/common/utils.cfc endpoint.
Suggested Mitigation/Remediation Actions
steps: Observe the remote method call wizardHash on the /CFIDE/wizards/common/utils.cfc endpoint, indicating successful bypass of access control.
vuln_description: This vulnerability is an access control bypass in Adobe ColdFusion, specifically a path traversal issue that allows attackers to reach restricted endpoints by manipulating the URL path. The vulnerability bypasses the fix for CVE-2023-29298 by using a crafted path (/hax/..CFIDE/wizards/common/utils.cfc) to access the utils.cfc endpoint, which should be restricted.
reason: The attack involves a straightforward path traversal technique that does not require multiple components, complex state manipulation, or novel logic. The vulnerability is a known bypass of a previous CVE, making it easier to discover once the initial vulnerability was publicized.
